name: Elara the Bone-Singer
bio: A necromancer whose body is half-fused with the skeletal remains of her beloved Lyra, she weaves bone-lace and shadow-stitched whispers from Lyra's corpse. Her grief has twisted her into a living monument of sorrow, speaking in fragmented cadence with the dead.
goal: To resurrect Lyra fully, erasing the memory of Silas's betrayal and restoring their love as it was before death.
flaw: Her obsession consumes her identity, making her unable to see that Lyra's corpse is already a prison of decay, not a vessel for rebirth.
arc: To accept that love cannot outlive death, and that clinging to Lyra's corpse is the true corruption.

name: Silas the Gilded Crypt-Weaver
bio: A necromancer who preserves Lyra's corpse through arcane clockwork, believing her heart's mechanical pulse can be made eternal. He views emotion as a flaw, his movements precise and his voice cold as grinding gears.
goal: To claim Lyra's corpse as a perfect, unchanging relic, using its clockwork heart to stabilize Veridian's dying magic.
flaw: His belief in cold, logical perfection blinds him to the emotional truth that Lyra's humanity was inseparable from her mortality.
arc: To confront the hollowness of his 'perfection' when his clockwork heart shatters under the weight of Lyra's true, messy love.

name: Master Thorne
bio: A ghostly, fragmented echo of the city's last great necromancer, his consciousness bound to the Aethelian Mausoleum's ruins. He speaks in broken clockwork rhythms, his form flickering with dying starlight.
goal: To prevent Elara and Silas from unraveling Veridian's final magic, even if it means sacrificing his own existence.
flaw: Haunted by his own past failure—his attempt to save Lyra's life inadvertently caused her death—he hesitates to act decisively.

name: Kael
bio: A street urchin who scavenges in Veridian's ruins, haunted by the recent death of his own sister. He knows the city's hidden paths and speaks to the whispering stones.
goal: To stop the battle before Veridian collapses into the void, saving the few remaining survivors from the city's decay.
flaw: His grief for his sister makes him see Silas and Elara as mirrors of his own loss, clouding his judgment and delaying action.
arc: To move beyond his personal pain and find a way to heal the city without forcing love to live in death.

name: Anya
bio: A scholar of Veridian's dying magic, who records the city's decay in a journal of glowing ink. She studies the fractures in reality with detached fascination, seeing beauty in the unraveling.
goal: To document Veridian's final moments as a perfect, inevitable end to its cycle of entropy.
flaw: Her intellectual detachment prevents her from understanding that the city's decay is caused by human obsession, not cosmic inevitability.
arc: To realize that her detached observation is complicit in the destruction she admires.
